meanings.def: one of the five small parts that stick out from the foot; any similar part on the foot of an animal or bird
examples: the big/little toe (= the largest/smallest toe)
I stubbed my toe on the step.
Can you touch your toes? (= by bending over while keeping your legs straight)
She wiggled her fingers and toes thoughtfully.
on your toes She stood on her toes and kissed him.
They are ground birds with long toes and claws.
He stepped on my toe while we were dancing!
Luckily, a truck came to tow our car to safety.
He had some kind of fungus between his toes.
He moved lightly on his toes like a boxer.
I dipped my toe in the river to test the temperature.
I stood on the tips of my toes to look through the window.
Ouch! That was my toe you just trod on.
She stood on her toes to kiss him.
She tapped her toes to the music.
The shoe pressed painfully against her big toe.
Under his bare toes the floor felt gritty.

meanings.def: the part of a sock, shoe, etc. that covers the toes
examples: He kicked the earth with the toe of his boot.

meanings.def: having the type or number of toes mentioned
examples: open-toed sandals
a three-toed sloth

meanings.def: to refuse to do something or to change your mind about something
examples: They dug their toes in and would not lower the price.

meanings.def: to start doing something very carefully to see if it will be successful or not
examples: We decided to dip a toe in the computer games market.
We were covered from head to foot in mud.
She was dressed from head to toe in red.
She was dressed in green from top to toe.

meanings.def: to make sure that somebody is ready to deal with anything that might happen by doing things that they are not expecting
examples: Surprise visits help to keep the staff on their toes.
The threat of inspections kept us all on our toes.

meanings.def: to make somebody feel embarrassed or uncomfortable
examples: The man's broad smile made her toes curl.

meanings.def: to offend or annoy somebody, especially by getting involved in something that is their responsibility
examples: I don’t want to tread on anybody’s toes so I’ll keep quiet.

idioms.def: to refuse to do something or to change your mind about something
examples: They dug their toes in and would not lower the price.

idioms.idiom: dip a toe in/into something | dip a toe in/into the water
idioms.def: to start doing something very carefully to see if it will be successful or not
examples: We decided to dip a toe in the computer games market.
We were covered from head to foot in mud.
She was dressed from head to toe in red.
She was dressed in green from top to toe.

idioms.def: to make sure that somebody is ready to deal with anything that might happen by doing things that they are not expecting
examples: Surprise visits help to keep the staff on their toes.
The threat of inspections kept us all on our toes.

idioms.def: to make somebody feel embarrassed or uncomfortable
examples: The man's broad smile made her toes curl.

idioms.def: to offend or annoy somebody, especially by getting involved in something that is their responsibility
examples: I don’t want to tread on anybody’s toes so I’ll keep quiet.

related: dip a toe in/into the water

meanings.def: to say or do what somebody in authority tells you to say or do, even if you do not share the same opinions, etc.
examples: One or two of them refused to toe the line.
MPs rarely fail to toe the party line.

idioms.def: to say or do what somebody in authority tells you to say or do, even if you do not share the same opinions, etc.
examples: One or two of them refused to toe the line.
MPs rarely fail to toe the party line.
